title: Syrian Sources Say Iranian Affiliated Militia Members Killed in Israeli Strike - Israel News
message:
16 pro-Iranian militants were killed in an Israeli-attributed airstrike in northern Syria, according to reports by the Syrian Center for Human Rights.
The target of the strike, according to the reports, was a copper factory and Iranian-linked weapons warehouse.
The Syrian army confirmed details early on Monday regarding the Israeli-attributed strike.
According to the Syrian Arab News Agency, the attack, which happened not long after midnight, hit several compounds, causing casualties and damage.
Last week, the Syrian news agency reported that one girl was killed, and ten others wounded, in an alleged Israeli strike on a residential area in the city of Baniyas in the country's west.
event_breakdown: Pro-Iranian Militants Killed in Syria in an Attack Attributed to Israel

title: Georgian Parliamentary Speaker Signs Controversial  Foreign Agent  Bill Into Law
message:
TBILISI -- Georgia's divisive "foreign agent" piece of legislation has become law despite weeks of mass protests and warnings from the United States and the European Union that the move jeopardizes the Caucasus country's path toward North-Atlantic integration.
The law was published in Georgia's Legislative Gazette on June 3 shortly after being signed by parliamentary speaker Shalva Papuashvil.
Georgian Dream has insisted it remains committed to joining Western institutions and the law was only meant to increase transparency on NGO funding.
The previous day, Georgia's opposition United National Movement said its offices in Tbilisi were attacked overnight by dozens of masked men, with glass broken and equipment damaged.
It alleged that the damage was inflicted by 30-40 "titushky," a term for the frequently masked thugs who have beaten and harassed protesters since Georgian Dream announced in March that it was reintroducing the bill.

title: 2 Killed In Israeli Airstrike On Lebanese Village
message:
(MENAFN- IANS) Beirut, June 3 (IANS) Two people were killed and four others in an Israeli on the southeastern Lebanese village of Houla, Lebanese military sources said.
The sources, who spoke anonymously, said on Sunday that an Israeli warplane bombed a house in central Houla with four air-to-surface missiles, wounding four civilians and killing two livestock herders, Xinhua news agency reported.
Israel carried out 11 on seven towns and villages in the eastern and central areas of the border region and fired 70 shells on 13 villages and towns in the southern border region, the sources added.
Meanwhile, the Lebanese armed group Hezbollah said it attacked several Israeli sites, including al-Sammaqa, al-Ramtha, Kiryat Shmona, Al-Abad, and al-Marj.
Israel then retaliated by firing heavy artillery toward southeastern Lebanon.
event_breakdown:
1- Two people were killed and four others in an Israeli airstrike on the southeastern Lebanese village of Houla.
2- Lebanese military sources said that an Israeli warplane bombed a house in central Houla with four air-to-surface missiles, wounding four civilians and killing two livestock herders.
3- Israel carried out 11 airstrikes on seven towns and villages in the eastern and central areas of the border region and fired 70 shells on 13 villages and towns in the southern border region.
4- The Lebanese armed group Hezbollah said it attacked several Israeli sites, including al-Sammaqa, al-Ramtha, Kiryat Shmona, Al-Abad, and al-Marj.
5- Israel then retaliated by firing heavy artillery toward southeastern Lebanon.

title: Real target of Dalston shooting says  I wish it was me
message:
The target for the gangland shooting which left a schoolgirl fighting for her life survived a previous assassination attempt and wishes the bullet had hit him rather than the innocent child.
Beytullah Gunduz, who has been linked to the Turkish underworld, was with friends outside a restaurant in Dalston until 15 minutes before a gunman opened fire on diners last week.
He returned to the restaurant to find three of his friends with gunshot wounds.
The girl, who had been sitting with her family inside, was on the floor after being shot in the head.
The attack has led to concerns that the shooting will reignite a bloody gang war between Tottenham Turks and their rivals, the Hackney Turks.

New Israeli Settlements
Israel's military said it plans to build more than 4,000 new housing units in West Bank settlements, defying a United Nations resolution against settlement construction. In a statement, the military said the settlement construction would "enable normal life for the residents". The UN Security Council adopted a resolution in December 2016 that declared settlements illegal and an obstacle to peace.
Violent Clashes Erupt Between Israelis, Palestinians
Violent clashes erupted between Israeli police and Palestinian protesters in Jerusalem and the West Bank. At least 224 Palestinians were wounded by rubber bullets and tear gas, according to Palestinian health officials. Clashes took place near the Temple Mount, Islam's holy site, following rumors of possible changes to rules at the site. Israeli officials say no changes have been made.
Israel's Military Plans to Investigate Claims of Rights Violations
Israel's military said it would investigate footage released by human rights group B'Tselem, which showed the fatal shooting of a Palestinian motorist in the West Bank. The military said they will be examining the incident to ensure it was carried out in accordance with Israeli law. The video released by B'Tselem suggests a Palestinian motorist attempted to carry out a car-ramming attack against soldiers.

title: Hezbollah strikes Israeli bases as clashes intensify - Newspaper
message:
BEIRUT: Hezbollah said on Sunday its fighters had bombarded two army bases in the Israeli-annexed Golan Heights within hours, after deadly Israeli strikes on south Lebanon.
The Israeli military said “approximately 15 projectiles” had been fired from Lebanon at the Golan Heights and “fell in open areas”, causing no injuries but starting fires.
The Hezbollah annou­nce­ment came several hours after Israeli forces struck the group’s positions in eastern and southern Lebanon.
Israeli jets had “struck a Hezbollah military structure in the area of Hula, from which projectiles were fired” at an Israeli village across the border, the military said.
In response, Hezbollah said it launched several attacks on Israeli military targets and shot down an Israeli Hermes 900 drone.

title: German police officer injured in Mannheim mass stabbing dies
message:
View of the crime scene after a knife attack in the city centre in Mannheim, Germany, on Friday.
A police officer who was among the six injured in the attack died Sunday, authorities said.
Photo by Ronald Wittek/EPA-EFEJune 2 (UPI) -- A German police officer who was among the half dozen people injured in a mass stabbing attack in Mannheim on Friday has died of his injuries, authorities said Sunday.
"We mourn the loss of a police officer who gave his life for our safety," the Mannheim Police Department said in a statement.
An arrest warrant for attempted murder has been issued for the suspect, authorities said before the officer had died.

title: Vladimir Putin Strikes Ukraine Largest Hydro - Electricity Plant : Photos
message:
The Dnipro plant, situated on a bridge in Zaporizhzhia, was struck by the 600-mph rocket despite having been targeted by Russian forces previously on March 22.
Ukrainian workers were still in the process of repairing the plant from the previous attack when the missiles hit, exacerbating the damage caused.
The assault, part of an overnight blitz employing KH-101 missiles, marks the second major attack on the Dnipro Hydro-electric Power Plant since March.
The plant's generating capacity has been severely crippled, with any breach of the 200ft dam posing a significant risk of flooding downstream.

title: Russian forces down 62 Ukrainian drones , 14 HIMARS rockets
message:
Russian forces down 62 Ukrainian drones, 14 HIMARS rocketsIran Press TVSunday, 02 June 2024 5:15 AMRussian air defense forces have downed 62 Ukrainian drones, 14 HIMARS rockets and three Hammer bombs, according to a report by the Russian Defense Ministry.
Russian forces dealt a heavy retaliatory blow to Ukraine's power facilities as the Kiev forces had planned to strike Russian energy infrastructure, the report reads.
The ministry also said that Russia's Battlegroup South took up better forward-edge positions, causing Ukrainian forces to sustain roughly 660 casualties.
Russia's Battlegroup East units seized vantage points in the past day, inflicting over 120 casualties on the Ukrainian forces.
Also, Ukrainian forces lost an armored combat vehicle, four cars and a 122mm D-30 howitzer, it said.
event_breakdown: Russian forces have downed 62 Ukrainian drones, 14 HIMARS rockets and three Hammer bombs, according to a report by the Russian Defense Ministry.

title: 12 Iranian Militiamen Killed in Israeli Attack near Aleppo , Syria | The Jewish Press - JewishPress . com | David Israel | 26 Iyyar 5784 – Monday , June 3 , 2024
message:
Photo Credit: SOHR ScreenshotThe official Syrian news agency SANA on Monday morning reported that “several civilians were martyred at dawn on Monday in an Israeli missile aggression that targeted several points in the vicinity of Aleppo city.”“At approximately 00:20 AM on Monday, the Israeli enemy launched an aerial attack with missiles from a direction southeast of Aleppo, targeting several points in the vicinity of Aleppo city, and the army air defenses intercepted the aggression’s missiles and shot down some of them,” SANA reported, citing a military source.
The source added that “the aggression led to the martyrdom of several civilians and some material losses to property.”AdvertisementThe opposition Syrian Observatory for Human Rights reported that “12 members of pro-Iranian militias of Syrian and non-Syrian nationalities” were killed (a preliminary toll), as a result of “an Israeli air strike on a site in the town of Hayyan in the northern countryside of Aleppo, where the targeting resulted in successive explosions in the copper factory in the area.”The Syrian Observatory indicated that “successive strong explosions occurred in the town of Hayyan in the northern countryside of Aleppo, resulting from a missile targeting of the copper factory, as the town is controlled by Iranian militias of Syrian and non-Syrian nationalities, while ambulances and fire brigades rushed to the area to put out the fires and transport injured people.”“The explosions followed a bombardment with high-explosive Volcano missiles that were launched from the western countryside of Aleppo on the positions of Hay’at Tahrir al-Sham (Organization for the Liberation of the Levant, or Levant Liberation Committee) and its factions in Kafarama and Nuran in the western countryside of Aleppo,” the SOHR added.
The Burkan-2H, or Volcano-2H, is a mobile short-range ballistic missile made in Iran and used by the Houthis militants in Yemen.
event_breakdown:
1. Israeli air strike on a site in the town of Hayyan in the northern countryside of Aleppo.
2. Syrian air defenses intercepted the aggression’s missiles and shot down some of them.
3. The aggression led to the martyrdom of several civilians and some material losses to property.
4. The Syrian Observatory for Human Rights reported that “12 members of pro-Iranian militias of Syrian and non-Syrian nationalities” were killed as a result of “an Israeli air strike on a site in the town of Hayyan in the northern countryside of Aleppo.

title: Houthis Attack US Aircraft Carrier , Destroyer in Red Sea
message:
Houthis Attack US Aircraft Carrier, Destroyer in Red Sea - Military SpokesmanSputnik News20240602MOSCOW (Sputnik) - Yemen's Ansar Allah movement, also known as Houthis, attacked a US aircraft carrier, destroyer and a number of ships in the Red Sea, Houthi military spokesman Yahya Saree said.
"The US aircraft carrier Dwight Eisenhower was attacked in the northern Red Sea with several missiles and drones," Saree said, adding that a US destroyer was also attacked in the Red Sea.
The movement's forces struck ships in the Red Sea, the Arabian Sea and the Indian Ocean that "belong to companies that violated the decision to ban passage to [Israeli] ports," the spokesman added.
Houthis vowed in November 2023 to attack any ships associated with Israel until it halts military actions in the Gaza Strip.
Amid the Houthi attacks, some companies suspended shipments through the Red Sea.

Location: Red Sea

title: Israel airstrike on Syria Aleppo causes casualties , material damage
message:
The Israeli regime has launched a new act of aggression against Syria’s northwestern city of Aleppo, causing casualties and some material damage.
Syria’s official SANA news agency, quoting an unnamed military source, said the new airstrike came from the direction of southeastern of Aleppo shortly after the midnight on Monday.
The report added that the Israeli strike targeted several locations in the vicinity of Aleppo, leaving a number of people dead while causing some material damage.
The statement by the Syrian military source did not specify the number of those killed in the attack and whether they were military personnel or civilians.
The regime’s attacks targeted a central site and a residential building in Baniyas city in Syria’s coastal region, as well as the countryside of the eastern Syrian city of Homs.

Israeli airstrike on Syria's Aleppo
Israeli military targeted several locations in the vicinity of Aleppo city, causing casualties and some material damage.

title: Palestinian sisters cry out for missing mother after Gaza airstrike
message:
Palestinian sisters Samar and Sahar grieve as they search for their missing mother Amira Al-Breim at the rubble of a house hit in an Israeli strike, in Khan Younis in the southern Gaza Strip, June 3, 2024.PHOTO:REUTERSAfter another airstrike pulverised Gaza, the two al-Breim sisters realised their mother Amira was missing and rushed to the scene, crying out her name and frantically sifting through rubble for any sign of her.
A dream," sobbed Samar al-Breim amid piles of collapsed concrete and twisted cables.
Children were also sleeping at the site of the airstrike in Khan Younis in southern Gaza, she said.
"My mother is stuck underneath here," she added, gesturing to the mounds of rubble.
Samar al-Breim clutched at a few random items amid the mounds of rubble.

title: Energy shutdowns hit Ukraine after Russian attacks target infrastructure
message:
(AP Photo/Alexander Zemlianichenko)By SAMYA KULLAB and ELISE MORTONUkraine imposed emergency power shutdowns in most of the country on Sunday, a day after Russia unleashed large-scale attacks on energy infrastructure and claimed it made gains in the eastern Donetsk province.
The shutdowns were in place in all but three regions of Ukraine following Saturday's drone and missile attack on energy targets that injured at least 19 people.
Ukraine’s state-owned power grid operator Ukrenergo said the shutdowns affected both industrial and household consumers.
Sustained Russian attacks on Ukraine’s power grid in recent weeks have forced the government to institute nationwide rolling blackouts.
In Russia, six people were injured in shelling in the city of Shebekino in the Belgorod region bordering Ukraine, regional Gov.

Russia attacked Ukraine's power grid in recent weeks, prompting nationwide rolling blackouts. Russia said the six people were injured in shelling in the town of Shebekino, near the Ukrainian border.

message:

The Israeli military said “approximately 15 projectiles” had been fired from Lebanon at the Golan Heights and “fell in open areas”, causing no injuries but starting fires.

title: From Leopard tanks to attacks on Russian soil : The red lines Ukraine has removed and those that remain
message:
The relationship between Ukraine and its NATO allies has followed a pattern of tug-of-war that has left Kyiv desperate.
Every major decision, from the delivery of German Leopard tanks to U.S. F-16 fighters, has been preceded by lengthy negotiations.
Now, one of the major red lines that had been in place since the beginning of Western support for the invaded country has been removed: the use of NATO weaponry against military targets on Russian soil.
The Kremlin concentrates its artillery positions, missile systems, aviation and drone units operating against Ukraine in the Russian province of Belgorod, bordering the invaded territory north of Kharkiv.
Armored infantry vehicles supplied by the U.S. and Poland were used in the May 2023 incursion into Russian territory by Russian paramilitary groups opposed to Putin.

title: Knife - wielding Florida teen allegedly murders boy at sleepover , injures adult :  Violent , premeditated attack
message:
A teenage boy is in custody after he stabbed another teen to death and wounded an adult during an ambush at a sleepover, the Sumter County Sheriff's Office in Florida announced.
He then threatened a third victim before stabbing an adult who came to check on the commotion.
Both stabbing victims were airlifted to an area hospital for further medical attention.
Gill was later pronounced dead, and the adult victim was still being treated for his injuries.
During a press conference on Sunday, Sumter County Undersheriff Pat Breeden said this was a premeditated and targeted attack.
event_breakdown:
Teen Kills Another and Stabs a Third During Sleepover
An unidentified teenage boy ambushed another teen and one adult during a sleepover early Sunday morning in Sumter County, Florida, stabbing both of them.

The Sumter County Sheriff's Office did not provide the identities of those involved. It also did not reveal what may have caused the fatal incident, which occurred around 2 a.m on Sunday.

James Booker Jr., an 18-year-old resident of Sumterville, has been charged with murder and attempted murder and is being detained in the Sumter County Adult Detention Center.

Two victims were taken to a nearby hospital. Police have yet to disclose the names and conditions of the people injured during the attack.

Breeden told public radio station WMNF, "We are still at the beginning of this case, and we're still putting it together," adding, "We are incredibly lucky that he didn't hurt anybody else."

So far in 2022, there have been 13 murders in Sumter County, the majority of which was in the first five months of the year.

title: Man stabs 2 foreign residents  for no reason
message:
A 37-year-old man has been indicted for attempted murder of two foreign residents in Incheon, local prosecutors said Monday.
He told officials that he was drunk and there was "no particular reason" for his actions.
It is unclear whether the stabbings were part of a random attack against anyone, or against foreigners specifically.
While the suspect launched an attack against four foreigners, Hambak Maeul is a rare village where the majority of its residents are non-Koreans.
As of 2023, about 61 percent of its 12,000 residents had foreign nationality.

title: Surface - to - surface missile shot down over Red Sea
message:
The IDF said it used the Arrow ballistic interceptor on Monday to shoot down a surface-to-surface missile launched in the Red Sea area, after sounding sirens in the port city of Eilat to send residents to shelters.
There was no word of any damage or casualties.
The military statement did not say who might have launched the missile.
Eilat has come under repeated long-range attack by Yemen's Houthi terrorists in solidarity with the Hamas war in Gaza.
event_breakdown: IDF shoots down surface-to-surface missile launched in the Red Sea area, according to a military statement. Israel uses the Arrow ballistic interceptor, setting off sirens in Eilat, a port city south of Israel's southern Tip.

title: IDF Arrow Defense System Intercepts Missile Fired Over Red Sea
message:
The IDF's Arrow defense system on Monday intercepted a surface-to-surface ballistic missile heading toward Israel from the direction of the Red Sea.
The missile, reportedly fired by Iran-backed Houthis in Yemen, targeted Eilat.
The Houthis have repeatedly launched ballistic missiles and drones at southern Israel since Hamas' Oct. 7 massacre.
Last week, an IAF fighter jet and aerial defense systems downed two drones fired "from the east" toward Eilat.
The group has claimed dozens of drone attacks on Israel since Hamas started the war on Oct. 7.
event_breakdown: IDF intercepts Houthi ballistic missile over Israel.

title: German police officer stabbed in neck and head in Mannheim , Germany , at anti - Islam event dies in hospital
message:
A policeman who was stabbed in the neck and head at an anti-Islam rally in Mannheim, Germany, has died from his injuries.
The 29-year-old officer, Rouven L., was stabbed multiple times in the horror knife attack after tackling another man to the ground.
Video of the attack showed Ataee swinging his knife wildly and slashing at a man’s thigh as he was brought to the ground.
In a joint statement, German police and prosecutors said the police officer underwent an emergency operation immediately after the attack and was put in an induced coma.
Speaking to Echo, a local newspaper, a local man said the knifeman “didn’t look like a bad guy”.

title: Russia claims capture of village in Ukraine Donetsk region
message:
File photo of a Soviet-era World War II monument near a destroyed cultural centre near Avdiivka, in Ukraine's Donetsk region taken on March 21 (AFP photo)MOSCOW — Russia's defence ministry claimed on Sunday to have captured a tiny village in the Donetsk region of eastern Ukraine, where it has been on the offensive making territorial gains.
Russian troops "have managed to liberate the village of Umanskoye in the popular republic of Donetsk", the ministry said in reference to the Ukrainian village of Umanske.
Umanske is a tiny village that had fewer than 180 inhabitants before Russia launched its military offensive in Ukraine in February 2022.
It lies about 25 kilometres to the northwest of Donetsk, which is the main city of the region and is under Russian control.
Meanwhile, a Ukrainian drone attack “on a car this morning” in the Kursk region “wounded three” people, who were taken to hospital, Governor Alexei Smirnov said.
event_breakdown: Russia-Ukraine Conflict: Russia's defence ministry claims to have captured tiny village in Ukraine's Donetsk region

title: Teen Forces Way Into Home , Fatally Stabs 15 - Year - Old During Sleepover : Cops
message:
A 16-year-old forced his way into a Florida home and fatally stabbed a 15-year-old during a sleepover the victim was hosting, Sumter County Undersheriff Pat Breeden announced on the department's Facebook page Sunday (June 3).
Alexander Hernandez was charged with premeditated first-degree murder, aggravated assault with a deadly weapon without intent to kill and armed burglary.
Gill opened the door and Hernandez fought his way inside, fatally stabbing him.
The adult victim, who was also airlifted, was reported to still be in ICU but in stable condition, according to Breeden.
Both Hernandez and the victim were homeschooled, however, it's unclear whether they knew each other prior to the incident.

Deadly Attack on Police Officer in Mannheim, Germany
A knife-wielding attacker stabbed and killed a police officer in the German city of Mannheim today. The attacker has been identified as Sulaiman Ataee, 25, who immigrated to Germany from Afghanistan in 2014 when he was just 15. He was shot dead by police after the attack. Chancellor Scholz said he was "deeply saddened" by the death of the officer and that "every attack is an attack against all of us, against our free democratic state and those who ensure our security".

The stabbing took place at a rally organised by Pax Europa, an anti-Islam group, where the perpetrator is believed to have tried to enter a building with a knife and shouting "Allahu Akbar". A bystander who was also injured in the attack describes the attacker as "insane, like crazy" and that he had attempted to attack the rally by storming the Germans group's building but failed to get in.  The makeshift building was the site of a rally and an anti-Islam meeting, where civilians attempted to restrain the attacker.

This is an investigation of the stabbing of two individuals, one of which was a police officer, in Germany's southwestern city of Mannheim. title: At least 12 killed in Israeli attack on Syria Aleppo region
message:

Israel launched the attack after midnight from a position south-east of Aleppo, a Syrian military source told state news agency Sana on Monday.
Its missiles pounded areas around Aleppo city, leading to “several martyrs and some damage”, the source said.
Iran's Tasnim news agency said that an “adviser” to the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps was killed in the strikes.

title: Photographer Who Captured Reagan Assassination Attempt Dies Age 77
message:
Pulitzer prize-winning photographer Ron Edmonds has died at age 77.
Edmonds was the senior White House photographer for The Associated Press (AP) and captured the Ronald Reagan assassination attempt in 1981.
Edmonds died of pneumonia, his wife Grace Feliciano Edmonds tells The Washington Post, on May 31 in Falls Church, Virginia.
His remarkable set of photos showing President Reagan being shot outside a hotel in Washington before being bundled into the limousine where he was then whisked to a hospital for life-saving surgery are once-in-a-lifetime.
The Reagan assassination attempt photo came on what was only Edmonds’ second day as the AP’s White House photographer covering Reagan.

title: Western experts ridicule Russian  Mad Max  motorcycles in combat
message:
"Chicken cages" cause motorcycles of the Russian Armed Forces to lose speed and maneuverabilityRussian troops employing motorcycles to storm Ukrainian positions have drawn ridicule from Western military analysts, according to a June 2 report by Forbes.
The vulnerability of motorcycles in combat is a primary concern, as they offer little protection in their original form.
To address this, Russian forces have reportedly been retrofitting motorcycles with so-called "chicken cages" to shield against prevalent Ukrainian drone attacks.
Historically, motorcycles lost their appeal as combat vehicles early in the 20th century due to their high vulnerability and limited combat effectiveness.
"More than one army learned this the hard way in the 1910s and '20s, arguably a golden era for military motorcycles," the article states.

title: Remembering D - Day : Key facts and figures about the invasion that changed the course of World War II
message:
Remembering D-Day: Key facts and figures about the invasion that changed the course of World War IIOMAHA BEACH, France (AP) — The June 6, 1944, D-Day invasion of Nazi-occupied France was unprecedented in scale and audacity, using the largest-ever armada of ships, troops, planes and vehicles to punch a hole in Adolf Hitler's defenses in western Europe and change the course of World War II.
WHO TOOK PARTNearly 160,000 Allied troops landed in Normandy on June 6, 1944.
VICTIMS ON ALL SIDESA total of 4,414 Allied troops were killed on D-Day itself, including 2,501 Americans.
The exact German casualties aren’t known, but historians estimate between 4,000 and 9,000 men were killed, wounded or missing during the D-Day invasion alone.
It's unclear how many D-Day veterans are still alive.
event_breakdown:

A new outbreak of fighting has been reported in South Sudan, endangering civilians and threatening to reignite a conflict that killed tens of thousands of people before a tentative peace agreement three years ago.

The flare-up of violence was reported in the northern part of the country, far from the capital, Juba, according to a United Nations peacekeeping mission. The mission, known as the United Nations Mission in South Sudan, said that a "major engagement" had erupted between government troops and forces loyal to a rebel leader, Riek Machar, in an area that has seen several clashes since the two sides signed a peace deal in August 2015. South Sudan has seen intermittent violence since then.

The mission reported heavy gunfire and use of heavy weapons near the town of Pagak and the nearby town of Bangolo. Mr. Machar's force withdrew from the town of Bantiu and South Sudan on Sunday, according to the mission.

The agreement signed in 2015 was hailed as a breakthrough, but a civil war that broke out in 2013 killed tens of thousands of people and displaced millions. The United Nations is trying to broker a peace deal between Mr. Machar and the South Sudanese government of President Salva Kiir.

title: 2 Japanese F - 35 fighter jets make emergency landings after 1 has a mechanical problem
message:
Two Japanese F-35A stealth fighter jets have made emergency landings at a commercial airport in northern Japan on Monday, but there are no injuries or damageBy The Associated PressTOKYO -- Two Japanese F-35A stealth fighter jets made emergency landings at a commercial airport in northern Japan on Monday, but there were no injuries or damage, officials said.
The fighter jets were on a training flight from Misawa Air Base and landed safely at nearby Aomori Airport after one developed an unspecified mechanical problem and requested an emergency landing, airport officials said.
Japan's Air Self Defense Force declined to provide details, including the cause of the emergency landing.
The airport said its runway was closed for about 20 minutes because of the emergency landing before operations returned to normal.
The incident is the latest in a series of problems involving flight training by Japan's military.

title: Historic WWII warplanes exhibit at Rock Hill - York airport
message:
Historic WWII warplanes exhibit at Rock Hill-York airportROCK HILL, S.C. (QUEEN CITY NEWS) — Two rare and historic WWII aircrafts visit for a public exhibition at the Rock Hill-York County airport.
The Airbase Arizona Flying Museum in Mesa, Arizona brought the bomber warplanes, B-25 Mitchell ‘Maid in the Shade’ and B-17 Flying Fortress ‘Sentimental Journey, to Rock Hill-York County Airport for the public to tour.
B-25 Mitchell arrived Sunday and the B-17 Flying Fortress arrived Monday afternoon.
B-25 Mitchell was used in the historic raid over Tokyo in 1942 by the Doolittle Raiders.
To ‘book your flight’ with the aircrafts, visit the Arizona Airbase website.

title: L . A . Co . Supervisor Hahn hosts Pride flag raising ceremony in Downey after council banned them from city property
message:
Supervisor Hahn hosts Pride flag raising ceremony in Downey after council banned them from city propertyLos Angeles County Supervisor Janice Hahn held a Pride flag raising ceremony in Downey on Monday, weeks after the local city council voted to ban the flags on city property.
“There will be pride in Downey this June,” Supervisor Hahn said when she announced the ceremony in late May.
“Despite the recent vote by the Downey City Council, I want out LGBTQ+ Downey residents to know they belong and that they are not only accepted but celebrated.”The flag was raised on Monday morning at the L.A. County Office of Education in Downey.
The education office is one of eight L.A. County properties in the city that will fly the flag for Pride month.
Downey Mayor Mario Trujillo – who voted against the flag ban and serves on the Board of Directors for the L.A. County LGBTQ+ Elected Officials Association – praised Supervisor Hahn’s efforts to uphold equality for all residents.

title: 2 Japanese F - 35 fighter jets make emergency landings after 1 has a mechanical problem – Winnipeg Free Press

The fighter jets were on a training flight from Misawa Air Base and landed safely at nearby Aomori Airport after one developed an unspecified mechanical problem and requested an emergency landing, airport officials said.
Japan’s Air Self Defense Force declined to provide details, including the cause of the emergency landing.

title: Taiwan Air Force to upgrade C - 130s starting 2025 : Source
message:
Taiwan Air Force to upgrade C-130s starting 2025: SourceROC Central News Agency06/02/2024 03:56 PMTaipei, June 2 (CNA) Taiwan's Air Force is planning to spend billions of Taiwan dollars to upgrade its existing C-130 military transport aircraft fleet starting next year to enhance its collision avoidance and sea rescue capabilities among other systems, a source familiar with the matter told CNA Sunday.
The planned overhaul of the Air Force's existing 20 C-130s is scheduled to take place from 2025 to 2030.
Taiwan's Air Force first bought 20 C-130Hs and another C-130HE, a modified electronic warfare aircraft, from the United States in the early 1980s.
The force lost one of its 20 C-130H, serial number 1310, in a 1997 crash at Taipei Songshan Airport.
The Air Force C-130 fleet currently has a total of 20 such models that serve as the main transporter aircraft for the nation's armed forces.

title: Seoul fully suspends inter - Korean military pact over trash balloons
message:

The move will allow the South to resume live fire drills and restart loudspeaker propaganda campaigns along the border with the North.
The South has used the loudspeaker campaigns - considered a psychological warfare tactic dating back to the 1950-53 Korean War - as a countermeasure to what it deems serious North Korean provocations.

Pyongyang said the trash balloons were retaliation for similar missives sent northwards by South Korean activists.

- The man, identified as Robert Parody, allegedly entered his mother's bedroom and stabbed her in the chest while she slept in the early morning hours of Saturday.
- Loretta Parody, the victim, was transported to a local hospital for emergency treatment but later pronounced deceased.
- Robert Parody was taken into custody by police and is awaiting trial.

title: 3 - year - old dies in what police say was random stabbing in Ohio grocery parking lot | iNFOnews
message:
3-year-old dies in what police say was random stabbing in Ohio grocery parking lotNORTH OLMSTED, Ohio (AP) — A 3-year-old boy stabbed by a woman in a grocery store parking lot in Ohio has died in what investigators believe was a random attack, police said.
The boy and his mother were going back to their vehicle after shopping at the Giant Eagle grocery on Monday when a woman ran at them with a knife, stabbing both of them, police said.
A 32-year-old woman was taken into custody at the scene in North Olmsted, a Cleveland suburb, police said.
The county medical examiner identified the boy as 3-year-old Julian Wood.
Police did not release the identity of his mother or her condition.

title: Elmer Boyd , Dallas detective who interrogated Lee Harvey Oswald – obituary
message:
Elmer Boyd, who has died aged 96, was one of the detectives who took Lee Harvey Oswald into custody following the assassination of John F Kennedy; he was thought to be the last surviving investigator of the president’s murder.
“We were told Kennedy was five minutes away from arrival, but then we got word he’d been in an accident,” Boyd recalled in 2017.
Later that day Oswald was arrested after slipping into a cinema without paying – the film playing was War Is Hell – and in a famous photograph Boyd and Sims were pictured escorting him into the police station.
Having worked several double shifts helping to interrogate Oswald, Boyd was sent home to rest, and was watching television with his family when Oswald was shot dead by Jack Ruby as he was being transferred to prison.
Boyd recognised Ruby, a well-known local figure, instantly.
event_breakdown: Oswald's assassination: On November 24, 1963, Lee Harvey Oswald was shot dead by Jack Ruby as he was being transferred to a prison. He was a presidential assassin who was a suspect in the assassination of John F Kennedy, the 35th President of the United States.

title: Deseret News archives : Evacuation at Dunkirk a pivotal moment in history
message:
The front page of the Deseret News on June 4, 1940, announcing the ongoing evacuation of Allied troops from Dunkirk, France.
A look back at local, national and world events through Deseret News archives.
In 1940, as casualties mounted across Europe, the Allied military evacuation of some 338,000 troops from Dunkirk, France, proved to be a pivotal moment in World War II.
An evacuation, code-name Operation Dynamo, was undertaken and wrapped up on this day in 1940, and the front pages of the world’s newspapers heralded the success of the operation.
For many, it became known as the Miracle of Dunkirk.
event_breakdown: Operation Dynamo, 1940: On this day in 1940, the Allied military evacuation of some 338,000 troops from Dunkirk, France, proved to be a pivotal moment in World War II.

title: Seoul fully suspends inter - Korean military pact over trash balloons
message:
This handout photo taken by the South Korean Defence Ministry between the night of June 1 and 2, 2024 and released on June 2, 2024 shows South Korean military officers check unidentified objects believed to be North Korean trash from balloons that crossed the inter-Korea border, on a street in Seoul.
Photo by Handout / South Korean Defence Ministry / AFPAFPSeoul: South Korea's President Yoon Suk Yeol fully suspended on Tuesday a 2018 tension-reducing military deal with the North in response to a bombardment of trash-carrying balloons sent by Pyongyang last week.
Pyongyang said the trash balloons were retaliation for similar missives sent northwards by South Korean activists.
The hermit country is extremely sensitive about its people gaining access to South Korea's flourishing popular culture.
'Truths and love'Seoul's Joint Chiefs of Staff said the suspension "restores all military activities" in areas near the inter-Korean border.
event_breakdown: South Korea to suspend military deal with North Korea after balloon launches

title: Matan Vilnai :  There is no simple solution  to hostage dilemma
message:
Former IDF deputy chief Maj. Gen. Matan Vilnai recently addressed the hostages in an interview on 104.5FM radio.
Technically, it is possible to transfer hostages from Gaza to the Egyptian side through the tunnels in the Philadelphi Corridor.
Vilnai later explained aspects of the Philadelphi Corridor by stating, "The Philadelphi Corridor is on the border between the Gaza Strip and Sinai.
Regarding the development of the war in Rafah, Vilnai claimed, "Currently, this is combat against the last remaining Hamas battalions.
It should have been dealt with before going to war," Vilnai emphasized.
